results.title: Eggs
results.brief_description: This film deals with the mass-production of eggs for commercial marketing, and illustrates the technological devices used to speed up the output of eggs per day. Correct feeding and care of the hens in the laying houses, the gathering of eggs from both open and trap nests, the cooling and automatic handling, grading, cleaning, and packing of the eggs for the market are studied.
results.description: This film deals with the mass-production of eggs for commercial marketing, and illustrates the technological devices used to speed up the output of eggs per day. results.title: Egghead's robot (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Cecil Musk, Australian Council for Children's Film and Television and Milo Lewis
results.brief_description: A very funny comedy about Paul “Egghead” Wentworth, the son of an inventor, who makes a look-alike robot to do his chores and replace him at sports. All goes well until the robot is named “cricketer of the year”, then blows a fuse in the compost heap! Written by Leif Saxon. Rated: G

results.title: Egg-ceptional
results.brief_description: A deceptively simple film about an egg who doesn’t fit. Superb animation details the various stages of the production process where the egg who is ‘different’ fails to meet the required specifications. A film that operates on a number of levels ranging from lower primary concepts of colour, number and size to the more abstract concepts of conformity, individual differences, desire for acceptance, etc.

results.title: Efftee Entertainers
results.brief_description: For the first time on video - the earliest Australian stage acts to appear on sound films - all transferred directly from quality original 35mm nitrate negatives and prints. Filmed on state-of-the-art Mitchell cameras with RCA sound, these long forgotten, `shorts’ open a window on the Australian Variety and Show world of the early 1930s.

results.title: Efftee entertainers
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and F.W. Thring
results.brief_description: This film provides footage of the earliest Australian stage acts to appear on sound films. These long forgotten ‘shorts’ open a window on the Australian Variety and Show world of the 1930’s. Footage includes famous local comics, singers and dancers: Stan Ray, George Moon, Minnie Love and Keith Desmond.

results.title: Efftee's Australia
results.brief_description: For the first time on video - the documentary output of Australia’s first talkie studio - Frank Thring senior’s Melbourne based Efftee Productions. All of these “shorts” have been transferred directly to video from 35 mm nitrate negatives and prints. Rated: G

results.title: Effects on alternating current and power factor
results.creator_credit: Frank A. Hoare, John Durst and Merton Park
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Electrical Induction and Capacity”.
Illustrates the effects of inductors and capacitors on alternating and direct current circuits; reduction of power factor by high natural capacity or inductance of AC circuit; use of inductors or capacitors to improve power-factors; applications to fluorescent lamps and telephone cables.

results.title: Effective writing: revise and improve
results.brief_description: Illustrates various ways in which writing can be improved by reconstructing sentences, substituting better words, and using the dictionary. Depicts the tribulations of a high school student attempting to write a composition. Produces images of the content of his composition on screen as he revises and corrects his work with the help of the narrator.
